meanings.definition: The period of time during which work is done.
meanings.sent1: I have to complete my workhour before I can go home.
meanings.sent2: The workhour at the office starts at 9 AM and ends at 5 PM.
meanings.sent3: During my workhour, I accidentally spilled coffee on my keyboard!
meanings.sent4: Her workhour seemed to stretch on forever as she struggled to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The workhour in the factory was filled with the sound of machines humming and workers chatting.

meanings.definition: A unit of time equal to 60 minutes.
meanings.sent1: I have a meeting scheduled for the next workhour.
meanings.sent2: She took a break every workhour to stretch and relax.
meanings.sent3: The workhour flew by as I lost track of time playing video games.
meanings.sent4: Each workhour felt like a race against the clock to get everything done.
meanings.sent5: The workhour on the clock seemed to tick by slowly as I waited for the bell to ring.
